intro: Nuxia tomentella f. farinosa, commonly known as the woolly nuxia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Proteaceae. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. This species is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
